articles.title: New dinosaur was a 32-foot-long predator with a crocodile face - Business Insider
articles.description: Remains of Europe's largest-ever land-based dinosaur have been discovered on the Isle of Wight in England, University of Southampton scientists say.
articles.content:
Dinosaur remains found off the south coast of England could be the largest land predator that ever roamed Europe, scientists say.

articles.author: Daniel Lawler
articles.title: Europe's 'largest predatory dinosaur' found by UK fossil hunter - Phys.org
articles.description: A giant crocodile-faced dinosaur, discovered on the Isle of Wight by one of Britain's best fossil hunters, was probably the largest predator ever to stalk Europe, scientists said on Thursday.
articles.content:

articles.title: Europe's largest meat-eating dinosaur found on Isle of Wight - Reuters
articles.description: Fossilized bones discovered on a rocky seashore on England's Isle of Wight are the remains of a meat-eating dinosaur that may be larger than any other known from Europe, a beast that was a cousin of the biggest carnivorous dinosaur species on record.
